 principal component analysis -- 4 arguments version computation is done via singular value decomposition coeff_out -> principal component coefficients score_out -> projected samples latent_out -> eigenvalues of principal vectors tsquared_out -> Hotelling's T^2 statistic

template<typename eT >
void op_princomp::direct_princomp ( Mat< eT > &  coeff_out,
Mat< eT > &  score_out,
Col< eT > &  latent_out,
Col< eT > &  tsquared_out,
const Mat< eT > &  in 
) [inline, static, inherited]

principal component analysis -- 4 arguments version computation is done via singular value decomposition coeff_out -> principal component coefficients score_out -> projected samples latent_out -> eigenvalues of principal vectors tsquared_out -> Hotelling's T^2 statistic

Definition at line 34 of file op_princomp_meat.hpp.

References Mat< eT >::cols(), Mat< eT >::copy_size(), diagmat(), mean(), Mat< eT >::n_cols, Mat< eT >::n_rows, repmat(), Mat< eT >::reset(), Col< eT >::rows(), Col< eT >::set_size(), sqrt(), sum(), svd(), Mat< eT >::zeros(), and Col< eT >::zeros().

00041   {
00042   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00043 
00044   const u32 n_rows = in.n_rows;
00045   const u32 n_cols = in.n_cols;
00046   
00047   if(n_rows > 1) // more than one sample
00048     {
00049     // subtract the mean - use score_out as temporary matrix
00050     score_out = in - repmat(mean(in), n_rows, 1);
00051     
00052     // singular value decomposition
00053     Mat<eT> U;
00054     Col<eT> s;
00055     
00056     const bool svd_ok = svd(U,s,coeff_out,score_out);
00057     arma_debug_check(svd_ok == false, "princomp(): singular value decomposition failed");
00058     
00059     //U.reset();  // TODO: do we need this ?  U will get automatically deleted anyway
00060     
00061     // normalize the eigenvalues
00062     s /= std::sqrt(n_rows - 1);
00063     
00064     // project the samples to the principals
00065     score_out *= coeff_out;
00066     
00067     if(n_rows <= n_cols) // number of samples is less than their dimensionality
00068       {
00069       score_out.cols(n_rows-1,n_cols-1).zeros();
00070       
00071       //Col<eT> s_tmp = zeros< Col<eT> >(n_cols);
00072       Col<eT> s_tmp(n_cols);
00073       s_tmp.zeros();
00074       
00075       s_tmp.rows(0,n_rows-2) = s.rows(0,n_rows-2);
00076       s = s_tmp;
00077           
00078       // compute the Hotelling's T-squared
00079       s_tmp.rows(0,n_rows-2) = eT(1) / s_tmp.rows(0,n_rows-2);
00080       
00081       const Mat<eT> S = score_out * diagmat(Col<eT>(s_tmp));   
00082       tsquared_out = sum(S%S,1); 
00083       }
00084     else
00085       {
00086       // compute the Hotelling's T-squared   
00087       const Mat<eT> S = score_out * diagmat(Col<eT>( eT(1) / s));
00088       tsquared_out = sum(S%S,1);
00089       }
00090             
00091     // compute the eigenvalues of the principal vectors
00092     latent_out = s%s;
00093     }
00094   else // single sample - row
00095     {
00096     if(n_rows == 1)
00097       {
00098       coeff_out = eye< Mat<eT> >(n_cols, n_cols);
00099       
00100       score_out.copy_size(in);
00101       score_out.zeros();
00102       
00103       latent_out.set_size(n_cols);
00104       latent_out.zeros();
00105       
00106       tsquared_out.set_size(1);
00107       tsquared_out.zeros();    
00108       }
00109     else
00110       {
00111       coeff_out.reset();
00112       score_out.reset();
00113       latent_out.reset();
00114       tsquared_out.reset();
00115       }
00116     }
00117   
00118   }
